channel.title: File Encryption on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in File Encryption on TLDRBins

item.title: GPG
item.description: GPG # Check version gpg --version # Generate new key gpg --gen-key # Export public key gpg --export -a <USER>@<DOMAIN> # Check keys gpg --list-keys # Import public key gpg --import <PUB_KEY> # Encrypt a message with public key (email from pub key) gpg --encrypt --armor -r <USER>@<DOMAIN> <FILE> # Decrypt a message with our private key gpg -d <ENC_FILE> # Sign our own message gpg --clearsign --output - <FILE>

item.title: Linux hard disk encryption
item.description: Brute force LUKS password bruteforce-luks -t 10 -f <WORDLIST> -w state.txt -v 30 <BACKUP_IMG> Note: This is slow, create a small wordlist Basic # Open cryptsetup open --type luks <BACKUP_IMG> backup # Check ls -l /dev/mapper/ # Create mount folder sudo mkdir /mnt/backup # Mount sudo mount /dev/mapper/backup /mnt/backup/

item.title: Password Cracking
item.description: Convert file to hash format # For example ssh2john id_rsa_encrypted > hash keepass2john test.kdbx > hash zip2john test.zip > hash # Get a full list of *2john find / -name *2john 2>/dev/null john hashcat # General use john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash # Specify hash format john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash --format=Raw-SHA512 # Show cracked hash john --show hash # Show cracked hash with specific format john --show hash --format=Raw-SHA512 # Auto detect hash format hashcat hash # Specify hash format hashcat -m 13400 -a 0 hash /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.
